WorkItem.ClosedComment: I believe this should work fine if you simply name the file "_references.ts" rather than '.js'. Please reactivate if it doesn't.
WorkItem.Description:
Hi,

I have found a big issue, in a complex .ts file I need many libs and plugins, like jQuery, jQuery UI and many plugins.

So I have to put in every .ts file I work on the references.
So, I thought it would be smart to have "_references.js" file with all the TypeScript definition files and do only this:
/// <reference path="..\..\..\TypeScript\Definitions\_references.js" />

Great, in my editor no errors, and no red lines, but on the right side in the generated JavaScript windows are many errors, that the name '$' does not exist and so on, if I copy the references out of the "_references.js" file directly in my .ts file, everything worked fine.


Best regards
WorkItem.Summary: Reference a "_references.js" file in a ".ts" file doesn't work

Comments.Message: Having references in the "_references.ts" file, doesn't make them available in other .ts files within the same folder. Using TypeScript 0.8.3.1, Visual Studio 2012.2, Web Essentials 2012 2.7
